name: Adelphi Suites Bangkok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my husband and i stayed at the adelphi suites for 10 nights in may, we found this to be a lovely comfortable hotel, the staff were friendly and always welcoming. Our room was 503, it was very stylish, clean, and the maid was a little gem.......she was very efficient in her job.
reviews.title: loved the adelphi

likes.disliked: — nice if there was a washer/drier in our room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The air conditioning was efficient but a little noisy, but the hotel itself was in a quiet location therefore there was no outside noise at night so you could get a decent nights sleep.
reviews.title: Loved this Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool on the 16th floor was small but sufficient as it was quiet when we stayed so there was no fighting for sunbeds, it was nice to sit up there in the evening there is a covered area with seating, and it was nice to enjoy the cool wind and watch the lightening storms, bangkok was extremely uncomfortably hot when we stayed, our pale western skins were finding it hard to acclimatize, so the pool was a godsend.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband took advantage of the very well equipped gym, fully airconditioned and with a television.
reviews.title: Excellent Suites but there are rooms 4 improvements

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was sufficient with plenty of choice, the only drawback is it would have looked nicer if the breakfast staff wore trousers instead of jeans and trainers it would have looked more professional, otherwise the staff were very polite and helpful. We will use the adelphi again when we come back to bangkok, as the location was perfect, only three minutes walk to the nana sky train. Travellers need to be aware of the constant badgering by taxi drivers, take note they will take you to unofficial ticket touts as they get a commission off tours, you need to be firm and say no you have already bought tickets for your trips, we were followed by taxi drivers insistant on getting a cut on the tours, in the end we had to be very firm to the point of being rude, which isnt in our natures to do so, so beware, the best way is to organise your tours through the hotel or the various excursion shops dotted around bangkok, as they come with a guide, the little shop round down the road (soi 8) round the corner, just before you come to nana sky train, they provided us with really good excursions and the guides spoke very good english. The best and cheapest way to get around bangkok is the sky train, beware of the tut tuts, a lot of them seem to be unable to know directions, we took one and the driver insisted on dropping us off outside the nana sky train, we had to give him directions, plus it didnt feel very safe and you get a mouthful of the city fumes, so all in all not a very healthy way to get around.
reviews.title: Home away from Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just spent 10 glorious nights at the Adelphi Suites. Great staff (especially Reception), small but excellent breakfast daily, beautiful and self sufficient rooms, great gym, great looking pool (except it was closed for renovations whilst we were there which was a shame) and best of all, great location (2 minutes walk to Nana station).
reviews.title: Loved loved loved the Adelphi Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008
reviews.text: We will definitely be back to stay again !!
reviews.title: Excellent Value, lovely suites, great location!

likes.disliked: — Buildling is not well finished in some places - but you have to look hard to see it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can't beat it for value for money, and location. The staff are lovely, many of them speak english. The executive suite is huge, and we absolutely loved the waterfall shower! The bed was one of the most comfortable we encountered in Thailand and Cambodia.
reviews.title: Fantastic, wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: BTS is a short walk, and there is a great pub (run by an Aussie/Kiwi) called Soi 8 which does great Phad Thai, Spring Rolls and Hamburgers. A great place to watch rugby too!
reviews.title: Position, position

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: We also stayed at the Pullman in Bangkok, and quite honestly there is no comparison, - the luxury of space and convenience is hard to beat! We highly recommend Adelphi, as great value for money - and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Bangkok's best value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a great value at around 3000 baht for a one bedroom suite. The staff were friendly and the rooms large. Laundry facilities in the room were very handy. They did not have the room we booked available upon our arrival so we took a smaller room for the first night then were moved to our room the next day which was inconvenient. The room we moved into also smelled of smoke and we booked NS. In the end, we should have stayed in the smaller room.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is new and the quality of the workmanship very poor. things like cabinet doors were outright broken and messy smears of caulk were all over each of the bathrooms we experienced. I hope they fix these things.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We loved the small rooftop pool and fitness center and the overall location of the property was superb (near the NANA station). As many have mentioned, the breakfast is not that good. To be specific, the breads and pastries were not fresh despite an abundance of fresh items in a big city like Bangkok. The staff's efforts to provide an "English Breakfast" was appreciated but not well executed. I would have rather not had this option and been offered fresh bread instead. The fruit was fresh though and you can't go wrong with that in Thailand.
reviews.title: Faboulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Adelphi Suites on a stopover on the way back from UK and overall had a great experience.
reviews.title: Couldn't ask for more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: The hotel was clean, smart, and the rooms were very big compared to many. We had a seperate couch, mini-kitchen, and the bed was super comfy.
reviews.title: My Second stay and again excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was simply a fabulous deal. Brand new hotel with nice, clean, spacious rooms. We rented a deluxe one bedroom which included dishwasher, washer/dryer, refridgerator, etc. Furnished with two flat screen TV's and at the time under $90 US per night. They had a nice variety of food for the breakfast buffet and the hotel is right near the train, shopping district and a number of fabulous restaurants. Beware of the Tuk-tuk drivers, they are a scam.
reviews.title: Great Deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Wow - I had a very pleasant stay of 7 nights at Adelphi Suites on Sukhumvit soi 8 in Bkk!
reviews.title: Perfect!

likes.liked: — guest friendly, internet access, staff, location... everything really.

reviews.text: On the sunny side:
reviews.title: Look no further!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - very friendly personnel, very helpful
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: - clean, modern, large, well-furnished rooms with big TV, DVD/CD player, small kitchen, etc.
reviews.title: Excellent!

likes.liked: — Size of the room, price, location.

description: Adelphi Suites is a hip property located on Sukhumvit Soi 8 and a 2 minute walk to the Nana BTS Skytrain Station. Adelphi Suites features 93 studios and one bedroom suites with a complete range of modern amenities which include high speed Internet connectivity, a fully-equipped kitchenette complete with cooking hobs and a high pressure rain shower. Additional facilities include an outdoor rooftop saltwater swimming pool, a well-equipped fitness center, Internet stations at the Lobby, a restaurant with alfresco dining and much more.
